result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan Mae Mihalko

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on March 24, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 8, 2023 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 7, 2023 at 02:15 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on November 9, 2022 at 11:45 am.

2:06 PM  Defendant Megan Mae Mihalko in court, in custody - in person.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Megan Mae Mihalko.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF12, 22CF143, 22CF169 and 22CM27. State -  here for STC/PH/BBH. Halyburton -  waiving PH and provided paperwork to the Court. Court has waiver of right to PH, finds defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right t PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Halyburton has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG to all charges on 22CF169. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for PTC/PLEAS/JT. Court will now hear the bail bond on 22CM27 as the poster has requested her money back. Halyburton states that Mihalko informed her that the $500.00 cash bond was Mihalko's, not Whitecloud. Whitecloud disagrees - states that money was hers. Halyburton makes further argument on the bond to probe that the money is Ms. Mihalko's. Court will have Ms. Whitecloud sworn in and warns about perjury, Court asks some questions prior to placing Ms. Whitecloud under oath. Court want Ms. Whitecloud in person, recess to do that. Recalled at 2:24 PM. Clerk swears in Adina Whitecloud. Court again advises Ms. Whitecloud that she is under oath and perjury. Defendant now wants to talk to her attorney first. Court will allow that. Court will set this for a BBH on 11/9/22 at 11:45 AM for 22CM27. Halyburton now wants to be heard on bond on 22CF169. Court will allow. Halyburton - bond - asks for a signature bond or $500.00 cash bond for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to reduction in bond for stated reasons. Court - bond on 22CF169- continues bond at this point.

2:06 PM  Defendant Megan Mae Mihalko in court, in custody - in person.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Megan Mae Mihalko.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF12, 22CF143, 22CF169 and 22CM27. State -  here for STC/PH/BBH. Halyburton -  waiving PH and provided paperwork to the Court. Court has waiver of right to PH, finds defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right t PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Halyburton has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG to all charges on 22CF169. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for PTC/PLEAS/JT. Court will now hear the bail bond on 22CM27 as the poster has requested her money back. Halyburton states that Mihalko informed her that the $500.00 cash bond was Mihalko's, not Whitecloud. Whitecloud disagrees - states that money was hers. Halyburton makes further argument on the bond to probe that the money is Ms. Mihalko's. Court will have Ms. Whitecloud sworn in and warns about perjury, Court asks some questions prior to placing Ms. Whitecloud under oath. Court want Ms. Whitecloud in person, recess to do that. Recalled at 2:24 PM. Clerk swears in Adina Whitecloud. Court again advises Ms. Whitecloud that she is under oath and perjury. Defendant now wants to talk to her attorney first. Court will allow that. Court will set this for a BBH on 11/9/22 at 11:45 AM for 22CM27. Halyburton now wants to be heard on bond on 22CF169. Court will allow. Halyburton - bond - asks for a signature bond or $500.00 cash bond for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to reduction in bond for stated reasons. Court - bond on 22CF169- continues bond at this point.

Poster requesting bond money back

10/19- letter requesting poster money back
Bail/bond hearing on October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:45 PM Defendant Megan Mae Mihalko in court, in custody from FC jail.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Megan Mae Mihalko.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. State believes will be a waiver. Attorney Halyburton agrees and has provided the court with waiver form. Court goes over preliminary hearing questionnaire waiver, finds defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving her right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information has been filed. Attorney Halyburton has received a copy of information, waives further reading, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas and will set for further proceedings. Attorney Halyburton asks the court that all her open cases track with her new case 22CF169 case. Court will allow cases to track. Court continues bond.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:09 AM Defendant Megan Mae Mihalko appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Megan Mae Mihalko.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Halyburton and Mihalko have complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH within time limits. Court continues bond, sets for PH on 10/12/22 at 2:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:53 AM Defendant Megan Mae Mihalko in court.  Attorney Breanna Halyburton appears in person. Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Halyburton appears specially, not appointed on this case yet, Mihalko will have to contact SPD for appointment. Mihalko has not received a copy of the complaint. Clerk will provide a copy to her in court. Court reads charges and penalties. Mihalko understands. Court will continue bond and have set for AIA.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
